caption.text:
If the points are arranged according to
Fig. 16
then each point tests stage movement in predominantly along one stage axis as summarized in this table.

statement.text: The value of 1 → 4 for relocation corresponds to the value of 3 → 4 for setup
The relocation is 2 → 1 when the setup is 4 → 1
The value of 4 → 3 for relocation corresponds to the value of 2 → 3 for setup
The relocation is 3 → 2 when the setup is 1 → 2
The value of 2 → 3 for setup corresponds to the value of 1 → 4 for relocation
The setup is 4 → 1 when the relocation is 3 → 2
The setup is 2 → 3 when the relocation is 3 → 2
The setup is 3 → 4 when the relocation is 4 → 3
The value −X vs +X belongs to relocation
The value −X vs +X belongs to setup
Setup always has the same value.

caption.text:
A summary of the validation methods. Many of these tests are useful for instrument validation in forensic and other applications of SEMs and EDS. The columns
Imaging
,
X-ray
and
Automation
identify which tests are also relevant for imaging-only applications, EDS applications and automated particle analysis applications.

statement.text: Automation always has the same value.
Section always has the same value.
